question: At its lower end, the embryonal axis has the ______ and root cap enclosed in an undifferentiated sheath called coleorrhiza.
At its lower end, the embryonal axis has the radical and root cap enclosed in an undifferentiated sheath called ______.
The portion of the embryonal axis above the level of attachment of scutellum is the ______.
Epicotyl has a shoot apex and a few leaf primordia enclosed in a hollow foliar structure, the ______.
In angiosperms, the ______ is the final product of sexual reproduction.
A seed is often described as a ______ ovule.
A seed typically consists of seed coat(s), ______(s) and an embryo axis.
The cotyledons of the embryo are simple structures, generally thick and swollen due to storage of ______.
Mature seeds may be non-albuminous or ______.
Non-albuminous seeds have no residual ______ as it is completely consumed during embryo development.
Examples of non-albuminous seeds are ______ and groundnut.
Albuminous seeds retain a part of ______ as it is not completely used up during embryo development.
Examples of albuminous seeds are wheat, maize, ______, castor.
Occasionally, in some seeds such as black pepper and beet, remnants of ______ are also persistent.
This residual, persistent nucellus is the ______.
Integuments of ovules harden as tough protective ______.
The ______ remains as a small pore in the seed coat.
The micropyle facilitates entry of ______ and water into the seed during germination.
As the seed matures, its water content is reduced and seeds become relatively dry, ______ per cent moisture by mass.
The embryo may enter a state of inactivity called ______.
As ovules mature into seeds, the ovary develops into a ______.
The wall of the ovary develops into the wall of fruit called ______.
The fruits may be fleshy as in guava, orange, ______, etc.
The fruits may be dry, as in ______ and mustard.
In a few species such as apple, strawberry, cashew, the ______ also contributes to fruit formation.
Such fruits in which thalamus contributes are called ______ fruits.
Most fruits develop only from the ovary and are called ______ fruits.
